text: at stream is a tech business providing
software for the media industry we
provide a asset management capability as
well as campaign fulfillment so we can
deliver any media content to any media
owner broadcaster digital print around
the world our journey to AWS started
probably about nine years ago we were
starting to deliver video files and
video advertising files to broadcasters
around the world
we had a platform which we were using
for that but it was quite old and it had
limited capabilities and we also saw the
need to expand from purely delivering
media to broadcasters and publishers to
managing the creative workflow so being
able to work with brands and agencies
throughout the creative process the
challenge for myself and my team was to
transform the business really into a
fully cloud hosted set of applications
and services we embarked on a project to
properly run our services and
applications on the cloud so we're now
fully DevOps automated and we've really
kind of embraced the whole existence and
you know provide a far better service to
our clients and users as a result years
ago we were spending half of our time
worrying about physical infrastructure
and now I don't worry about that at all
we've got far more important things to
worry about in terms of building
products than worrying about what
servers you've got and do you need to
buy another one I think it makes far
more sense to run your operation in that
you pay for what you use when you use it
and when you need it using AWS services
enables us to do two main things which I
don't think we would have had any chance
before so the first one is within the
development team the way that the
development teams now work with CIO CD
pipelines means that they've got far
more control the developers can be far
more engaged in the code that they're
writing and getting that code out to
live we're able to then regularly patch
changes and deploy new features and and
fixes to the live environment extremely
quickly and we've seen some of our
clients have had really great business
case returns because of the fact that
they can hole
their content locally historically this
stuff would get put on tapes and taken
around the world by a person on a bike
or in a plane so now it's instantly
accessible to anybody in the world
